text: Combine {{chicken_broth}} with {{bouillon}}, {{soy_sauce}}, {{onion_powder}}, {{mustard_powder}}, and {{thyme}} in a large measuring cup and set aside.
Combine {{flour_dredge}} and {{parmesan_dredge}} on a plate and measure remaining ingredients before cooking.
Slice {{chicken_breast}} in half lengthwise to form thinner cutlets. Cover and pound to an even thickness, then pat dry.
Season both sides of {{chicken_breast}} with {{italian_seasoning}}, {{salt}}, and {{black_pepper}}. Dredge in {{flour_dredge}} mixed with {{parmesan_dredge}}, tapping off excess.
Heat {{olive_oil}} in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sear {{chicken_breast}} for 4–5 minutes per side until golden. Remove and set aside.
Reduce heat to medium-low and melt {{butter}} in the same skillet. Add {{garlic_cloves}} and cook until softened and caramelized, about 6–7 minutes.
Sprinkle in {{flour_sauce}} and cook for 1–2 minutes, stirring until the raw flour smell is gone.
Gradually whisk in the reserved {{chicken_broth}} mixture with {{bouillon}}, {{soy_sauce}}, {{onion_powder}}, {{mustard_powder}}, and {{thyme}} until smooth.
Stir in {{heavy_cream}} and bring to a gentle boil, then reduce heat to low.
Return {{chicken_breast}} and any accumulated juices to the skillet. Spoon sauce over the top, cover partially, and simmer for 5 minutes.
